title: web_fetch: configurable backend with local Firecrawl support
description: Implement backend selection for web_fetch so users can route fetch/extraction through local or hosted Firecrawl via config, while keeping stable payload shape and safe fallbacks.
acceptance_criteria: Config supports explicit backend mode and Firecrawl endpoint selection; web_fetch selects backend per config; behavior is documented; tests cover mode selection and fallback/error behavior.
notes: Decisions (2026-02-17): 1) backend default = auto. 2) In auto mode, Firecrawl is considered available only when base_url is set and health/probe succeeds. 3) Auto mode falls back to native on all Firecrawl failures. 4) Keep URL safety checks before handing URLs to Firecrawl. 5) Payload may add backend field with existing fields preserved. 6) Send Authorization header only when api_key is configured.

title: Config schema: add web_fetch backend mode

title: web_fetch runtime: backend router
description: Route execution by backend mode: native, firecrawl-first, or auto with fallback. Keep output envelope/payload stable and include backend metadata field.
acceptance_criteria: native uses current path; firecrawl mode uses Firecrawl and fails clearly if unavailable; auto requires base_url + probe success to select Firecrawl and otherwise falls back to native on any Firecrawl failure; URL safety checks run before Firecrawl/native dispatch; response shape remains compatible and adds backend metadata.

title: Provider Login via Settings (web + mobile)
description:
Goal: provider login managed from Settings only (web + mobile), not model picker.

Design decisions (apply to both web and mobile):
- UX direction: utility/function, precision-density, borders-first surfaces.
- IA: Settings owns provider auth. Chat only shows lightweight redirect to Settings.
- Motion: purposeful, fast; 200ms ease-out enters, 160ms exits; reduced-motion respected.
- A11y: 44px targets, keyboard order, live status announcements, no layout shift on status changes.
- Platform parity: same status copy/state machine across web and mobile; platform-native presentation.
- Shared-first architecture: reuse and extend consolidated shared client/modules in src/apps/shared; avoid duplicated auth state logic across web/mobile.

Scope:
- Shared auth controller/state machine in src/apps/shared.
- Web settings provider accounts panel.
- Mobile settings provider accounts panel.
- Remove chat-surface auth blocks; add redirect/guard behavior.
- Tests + docs.
acceptance_criteria:
- User can complete provider device-code login from Settings on web and mobile.
- Provider status updates to Connected without app reload.
- Chat no longer hosts full provider login UI.
- Unauthorized provider usage in chat clearly directs user to Settings.
- Reduced-motion + keyboard/screen-reader behavior verified.
- Auth flow logic centralized in shared modules and reused by both clients.
notes:
Design doc created: docs/design/settings-provider-login.md  covers IA (4 sections: Connection, Providers, Preferences, About), web slide-over panel, mobile segmented control, shared useProviderAuth hook, animation spec, a11y spec, and 5-phase implementation plan.
Implementation complete (2026-02-16). All 6 tasks done via parallel agent team:
- Task 1: Shared useProviderAuth hook + settings types
- Task 2: Web settings panel scaffold (8 components)
- Task 3: Mobile settings segmented refactor (7 components)
- Task 4: Web provider accounts section wired up
- Task 5: Mobile provider accounts section wired up  
- Task 6: Chat auth redirect banners (web + mobile)
TypeScript compiles clean on shared + web. Pending: mobile tsc check, runtime testing, a11y audit.
